frameDefinitions: A Total has a Part, either  as a member of an aggregate or as  a constituent part of a simple entity.

The answer to one open question, the Outcome, is dictated (partially or completely) by the answer to another open question, the Determinant, i.e. if the answer to the Determinant is known, the answer to the Outcome can be predicted.

A Factor affects the outcome of an Undertaking, which  can be a goal-oriented activity or the maintenance of a desirable state, the work in a Field, or something portrayed as affecting an Interested_party.
A Concept_1 is related to Concept_2 by some Evidence.

The Attaching frame covers two situations: a scene in which somebody causes one thing to be physically connected to something else; or a scene in which somebody causes two things to be connected to each other.
A concept, Concept_1, is related causally or collocationally to another concept, Concept_2 by means of some evidence.
frameExamples: Economic policy is partially a <t>function</t> of cultural values.
Temperature is the most <t>critical</t> factor in successful storage.
The single remaining piece of evidence <t>linked</t> Kirov the tailor to Kirov the dissident activist.
The robber <t>tied</t> Harry to the chair.
listRoleDefinitions: A complex entity, either an aggregate or a unit, of which a <fen>Part</fen>,  a constituent or a component, is specified.
A component or constituent that is specified to form part of the <fen>Total</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Total</fen> includes the <fen>Part</fen>.
The location at which the <fen>Total</fen> includes the <fen>Part</fen>.
An open question that is (to some degree) predictable from the Determinant.
An open question that determines the <fen>Outcome</fen>.
<fen>Factor</fen> is used for the concrete or abstract entity whose importance is assessed.
The <fen>Undertaking</fen> is a process or state or field of activity in which the <fen>Interested_party</fen> has a stake.
<fen>Interested_party</fen> identifies the people who are affected by a particular <fen>Factor</fen>.
A <fen>Factor</fen> may be generally important to the people or the activities in a field of endeavour.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Factor</fen> is important to the <fen>Undertaking</fen>.
The location at which the <fen>Factor</fen> is important.
The concept which is linked to <fen>Concept_2</fen>.
The concept which is tied to <fen>Concept_1</fen>.
The phenomenon that points to or proves the connection between <fen>Concept_1</fen> and <fen>Concept_2</fen>. Generally expressed as an external.
The two concepts expressed jointly.

The <fen>Agent</fen> manipulates an object. <fen>Agent</fen> typically refers to animate beings, but is also extended to mechanical and other inanimate objects.  It is most frequently expressed as the external argument of verbs.
This role identifies the <fen>Item</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> attaches to the <fen>Goal</fen>.
<fen>Goal</fen> identifies the location to which an <fen>Item</fen> is attached.
The <fen>Connector</fen> forms the bond that maintains the <fen>Item</fen> or <fen>Items</fen> in a fixed position; it is usually expressed in a <ment>with</ment>-PP.
This role identifies the plural <fen>Items</fen> that are tied together, resulting in their mutual attachment.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> intentionally affects the <fen>Item</fen> or <fen>Items</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Agent</fen> intentionally affects an <fen>Item</fen> or <fen>Items</fen>.
The concept which is linked to <fen>Concept_2</fen>.  Generally expressed as the external argument.
The concept which is tied to <fen>Concept_1</fen>.  Generally expressed as a PP complement.
The two concepts expressed jointly.
listRoleExamples: <fex>His collection</fex> included two El Grecos
The larger album includes <fex>designs for his house at Whitehall</fex>.
<fex>Last year</fex> the recognized departments included the Russian and East European Institute, and the Office of International Programs.
<fex>In California</fex>, the category excludes minors and the mentally ill.
Price, in such a case, depends <fex>only on the whim of the supplier</fex>.
<fex>Being sure they are buying fresh food</fex> is important to most people.
Temperature is the most critical factor <fex>in successful storage</fex>.
Being sure they are buying fresh food is important <fex>to most people</fex>.
A successful GATT round is important <fex>for the world economy</fex>.
High death rates among smokers connect <fex>cigarettes</fex> with disease.
Skid marks on the street connects my neighbor's car <fex>to my broken mailbox</fex>.
<fex>Footprints</fex> connect her to the crime.
Ample evidence is able to connect <fex>the two</fex>.
<fex>The robber</fex> tied Harry to the chair.
The robber tied <fex>Harry</fex> to the chair.
The robber tied Harry <fex>to the chair</fex>.
The robber tied Harry to the chair  <fex>with a rope</fex>.
The robber tied <fex>Harry's ankles</fex> together.
The robber tied Harry to the chair <fex>at midnight</fex>.
The robber tied Harry to the chair <fex>in the basement</fex>.
<fex>Smoking</fex> is tied to cancer.
Smoking is tied <fex>to cancer</fex>.
<fex>Smoking and weight gain</fex> are connected.
